newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Benelux has first Internet book, music store.
newsitem.headline: Benelux has first Internet book, music store.

text.p: Remember the Internet being compared to a library with all the books on the floor?

Azur.be, a Dutch/Flemish company, allows you to neatly search its virtual shelves with over 300,000 book and music titles at its online store -- the first in the Benelux -- and to order with a couple clicks of your mouse.
Websurfers can find at the site located at the World Wide Web address (http://www.azur.be) approximately 100,000 books in Dutch, 140,000 books in English and 62,000 modern music CDs.
Video tapes and clasical music CDs should be available in the near future as well as English and French versions of the site now in Dutch, Azur.be said.
Azur.be also offers a virtual shopping basket where clients can stock articles they want to buy. Shoppers can decide to add to the the basket or to drop the items selected.
